meanings.definition: A large black-and-white marine mammal (Orcinus orca) with a tall dorsal fin, known for its intelligence and social behavior.
meanings.sent1: The orcas swam gracefully in the ocean, showing off their intelligence.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study orcas to learn more about their social behavior.
meanings.sent3: The orcas decided to have a party to celebrate their latest discovery.
meanings.sent4: Watching the orcas interact is like observing a close-knit community.
meanings.sent5: The orcas' tall dorsal fin makes them easily recognizable in the water.

meanings.definition: A type of killer whale found in all oceans.
meanings.sent1: We saw a pod of orcas hunting for food near the coast.
meanings.sent2: Many documentaries feature orcas swimming in the wild.
meanings.sent3: The orcas challenged each other to a race to see who was the fastest.
meanings.sent4: The orcas' hunting skills are unmatched in the ocean.
meanings.sent5: The sight of orcas breaching the surface is truly breathtaking.
